intro: Alyxia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pinkish flowers. Alyxia stenophylla typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in scrub or chaparral environments. It is an evergreen shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with woody stems and showy floral displays.
